reviewText: I've done this DVD twice; the 30 minute step aerobic section and the strengh training and abs sections.  (I'm not up to the 50 minute interval step section yet.)  It's great.  The step section is interesting and fun.  Not too dancy, but still some moves I haven't see before.  The m/t sections are tough.  I've been working out 3 days a week for over a year and I was a bit sore after doing the workout the first time.I highly recommend this DVD to beginners ready for the next level.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is such a good workout.  There are actually two full step routines here.  The first is only step and the second is interval step.  Then, after both of those, there are some targeted toning workouts.  This will make you sweat, huff and puff and tone your body and lose weight.  Cathe is a good instructor.  She knows her stuff and she is tough.  All the workouts are really well cued and the choreography is good.  The combinations are easy to follow and she uses easy transitions to get you into the next step pattern.  You need dumbells and a stability ball and also an X-ertube for the toning workout.This is very do-able and fun.  It will get your heart pumping and it's challenging.  It's everything you could want in a workout.  Who needs to go to the gym when you can do this so easily at anytime you choose?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Cathe always delivers, She is motivating and easy to follow, once you get used to her style. She cue's smoothly from move to move. I would recommend beginners start with this DVD to introduce yourself to her step workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own this DVD for 2 years now and it is still one of my favorites. Cathy Friedrich is by far my favorite instructor.She is very classy and intelligent, there is now tacky decorations or screaming "We are having fan, guys!" All her comments are to the point and she keeps count, so you can turn away from your TV if you want.Basic Step is for beginners, who doesn't have any experience with step aerobics at all. It is short and very basic.Body Fusion is more advanced, but not too much. And if you want more challenge, you can always add 1 more raiser to your platform. I am in mid 40's, been doing it regularly for 2 years and I do at on 8 inch(2 raisers) platform, instead of 1 raiser as DVD shows. It works for me perfectly. I highly recommend this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Admittedly, it took me a while to figure out the routine Ms. Freidriche uses in her video.  I usually work out about an hour doing step and other exercises, and I found once I got the drift of what was being attempted in this workout, that I could work up a bit of a sweat but not an excessive one.Having grown up on the Gin Miller approach with it's tapping and repetition, focusing more on working out all the muscles as possible, I found Friedrich's routine more difficult but less satisfying from a workout perspective.  I will still use it from time to time in order to vary my workouts, but as a bread and butter workout, I found it lacking.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Occasionally I'll try small sections of Cathe's workouts on FitTV.  But I'm never able to do one from start to finish.  But based on the reviews here, I thought I'd give this set a try.  The step moves are a lot more basic than Cathe's usual routines, but the even better news is that I definitely get that complete Cathe Friedrich workout that I've been wanting.  I mean, seriously, have you seen Cathe and those women who work out with her?  Give me their bodies any day.  Even though I've been stepping for more than a year and added strength training in the last six months, when I challenged myself to do the entire two hours and ten minutes of routines on this DVD, I wasn't sore the next day, I was sore within a FEW HOURS of completing it.  For me, that meant I'd worked unused areas harder than I had in a long time and so I felt I definitely got my money's worth with this DVD.Although the 30-minute Basic Step routine is almost too easy to give you much of a workout, you can easily combine it with the 50-minute Body Fusion circuit workout (three step routines, three weight routines) and/or the bonus routines - a 20-minute upper body, a 20-minute lower body and a 10-minute abs routine.  The 50-minute Body Fusion workout is plenty on its own.  I always go for the gusto and do them all and feel the thrill of victory when I'm done.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Cathe always delivers perfect cueing and instruction, which is why she's a favorite. She has a sing-songy voice with breathy cues. Her routines are very traditional - lots of lunges and common step moves - and the set is also very traditional - dark with lots of plants. You'll need lots of space - she quickly moves around all four sides of the space (tough to do in a small room with furniture around you). Body Fusion is broken into intervals with 9m of cardio and 3m of strength. My heartrate is around 60-70% of maximum and my legs ache the next day. Basic Step really is basic, you're not moving very much because the video is focused on teaching you classic step moves. I prefer CIA videos for their originality, but keep Cathe around because she knows what works.
Title: N/A
